channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Scaling and renormalization in high-dimensional regression
item.description: This paper presents a succinct derivation of the training and generalization performance of a variety of high-dimensional ridge regression models using the basic tools of random matrix theory and free probability.

item.title: Characterizing Information Seeking Processes with Multiple Physiological Signals
item.description: Information access systems are getting complex, and our understanding of user behavior during information seeking processes is mainly drawn from qualitative methods, such as observational studies or surveys.

item.title: Exploiting Positional Bias for Query-Agnostic Generative Content in Search
item.description: We demonstrate such defects by showing that non-relevant text--such as promotional content--can be easily injected into a document without adversely affecting its position in search results.

item.title: Global News Synchrony and Diversity During the Start of the COVID-19 Pandemic
item.description: News coverage profoundly affects how countries and individuals behave in international relations.

item.title: Are Models Biased on Text without Gender-related Language?
item.description: A key observation in prior work is that models reinforce stereotypes as a consequence of the gendered correlations that are present in the training data.

item.title: Predictive Accuracy-Based Active Learning for Medical Image Segmentation
item.description: Active learning is considered a viable solution to alleviate the contradiction between the high dependency of deep learning-based segmentation methods on annotated data and the expensive pixel-level annotation cost of medical images.

item.title: iMTSP: Solving Min-Max Multiple Traveling Salesman Problem with Imperative Learning
item.description: We address these issues by reformulating MTSP as a bilevel optimization problem, using the concept of imperative learning (IL).

item.title: No Representation, No Trust: Connecting Representation, Collapse, and Trust Issues in PPO
item.description: We draw connections between representation collapse, performance collapse, and trust region issues in PPO, and present Proximal Feature Optimization (PFO), a novel auxiliary loss, that along with other interventions shows that regularizing the representation dynamics improves the performance of PPO agents.

item.title: Harnessing the Power of Multiple Minds: Lessons Learned from LLM Routing
item.description: With the rapid development of LLMs, it is natural to ask how to harness their capabilities efficiently.

item.title: Covariant spatio-temporal receptive fields for neuromorphic computing
item.description: Here, we present a principled computational model for neuromorphic systems in terms of spatio-temporal receptive fields, based on affine Gaussian kernels over space and leaky-integrator and leaky integrate-and-fire models over time.

item.title: CrossMatch: Enhance Semi-Supervised Medical Image Segmentation with Perturbation Strategies and Knowledge Distillation
item.description: Semi-supervised learning for medical image segmentation presents a unique challenge of efficiently using limited labeled data while leveraging abundant unlabeled data.

item.title: Model Quantization and Hardware Acceleration for Vision Transformers: A Comprehensive Survey
item.description: Model quantization, by converting high-precision numbers to lower-precision, reduces the computational demands and memory needs of ViTs, allowing the creation of hardware specifically optimized for these quantized algorithms, boosting efficiency.

item.title: Learning to Compose: Improving Object Centric Learning by Injecting Compositionality
item.description: Learning compositional representation is a key aspect of object-centric learning as it enables flexible systematic generalization and supports complex visual reasoning.

item.title: UWAFA-GAN: Ultra-Wide-Angle Fluorescein Angiography Transformation via Multi-scale Generation and Registration Enhancement
item.description: Fundus photography, in combination with the ultra-wide-angle fundus (UWF) techniques, becomes an indispensable diagnostic tool in clinical settings by offering a more comprehensive view of the retina.

item.title: UCB-driven Utility Function Search for Multi-objective Reinforcement Learning
item.description: In Multi-objective Reinforcement Learning (MORL) agents are tasked with optimising decision-making behaviours that trade-off between multiple, possibly conflicting, objectives.

item.title: Adaptive Bidirectional Displacement for Semi-Supervised Medical Image Segmentation
item.description: Consistency learning is a central strategy to tackle unlabeled data in semi-supervised medical image segmentation (SSMIS), which enforces the model to produce consistent predictions under the perturbation.

item.title: AdaMoLE: Fine-Tuning Large Language Models with Adaptive Mixture of Low-Rank Adaptation Experts
item.description: We introduce AdaMoLE, a novel method for fine-tuning large language models (LLMs) through an Adaptive Mixture of Low-Rank Adaptation (LoRA) Experts.

item.title: TFPred: Learning Discriminative Representations from Unlabeled Data for Few-Label Rotating Machinery Fault Diagnosis
item.description: Recent advances in intelligent rotating machinery fault diagnosis have been enabled by the availability of massive labeled training data.

item.title: Active Learning with Task Adaptation Pre-training for Speech Emotion Recognition
item.description: To address these issues, we propose an active learning (AL)-based fine-tuning framework for SER, called \textsc{After}, that leverages task adaptation pre-training (TAPT) and AL methods to enhance performance and efficiency.

item.title: Self-supervised Pre-training of Text Recognizers
item.description: The evaluation shows that the self-supervised pre-training on data from the target domain is very effective, but it struggles to outperform transfer learning from closely related domains.

item.title: Spectrally Pruned Gaussian Fields with Neural Compensation
item.description: However, this comes with high memory consumption, e. g., a well-trained Gaussian field may utilize three million Gaussian primitives and over 700 MB of memory.

item.title: Arbitrary Time Information Modeling via Polynomial Approximation for Temporal Knowledge Graph Embedding
item.description: Distinguished from traditional knowledge graphs (KGs), temporal knowledge graphs (TKGs) must explore and reason over temporally evolving facts adequately.

item.title: RAPIDFlow: Recurrent Adaptable Pyramids with Iterative Decoding for Efficient Optical Flow Estimation
item.description: Extracting motion information from videos with optical flow estimation is vital in multiple practical robot applications.

item.title: Conformal Risk Control for Ordinal Classification
item.description: As a natural extension to the standard conformal prediction method, several conformal risk control methods have been recently developed and applied to various learning problems.

item.title: Transformer-based Reasoning for Learning Evolutionary Chain of Events on Temporal Knowledge Graph
item.description: We then craft a mixed-context reasoning module based on the multi-layer perceptron (MLP) to learn the unified representations of inter-quadruples for ECE while accomplishing temporal knowledge reasoning.

item.title: DAM: A Universal Dual Attention Mechanism for Multimodal Timeseries Cryptocurrency Trend Forecasting
item.description: In the distributed systems landscape, Blockchain has catalyzed the rise of cryptocurrencies, merging enhanced security and decentralization with significant investment opportunities.

item.title: Gradient-based Automatic Per-Weight Mixed Precision Quantization for Neural Networks On-Chip
item.description: Model size and inference speed at deployment time, are major challenges in many deep learning applications.

item.title: A First Look at Selection Bias in Preference Elicitation for Recommendation
item.description: Despite the fact that the extreme sparsity of preference elicitation interactions make them severely more prone to selection bias than natural interactions, the effect of selection bias in preference elicitation on the resulting recommendations has not been studied yet.

item.title: ASAM: Boosting Segment Anything Model with Adversarial Tuning
item.description: In the evolving landscape of computer vision, foundation models have emerged as pivotal tools, exhibiting exceptional adaptability to a myriad of tasks.

item.title: Be Aware of the Neighborhood Effect: Modeling Selection Bias under Interference
item.description: On this basis, we propose a novel ideal loss that can be used to deal with selection bias in the presence of neighborhood effect.

item.title: Countering Reward Over-optimization in LLM with Demonstration-Guided Reinforcement Learning
item.description: While Reinforcement Learning (RL) has been proven essential for tuning large language models (LLMs), it can lead to reward over-optimization (ROO).

item.title: MGCBS: An Optimal and Efficient Algorithm for Solving Multi-Goal Multi-Agent Path Finding Problem
item.description: However, this paper demonstrates that the methods based on DVS cannot always obtain the optimal solution.

item.title: Graph Neural Network Approach to Semantic Type Detection in Tables
item.description: This study addresses the challenge of detecting semantic column types in relational tables, a key task in many real-world applications.

item.title: SemiPL: A Semi-supervised Method for Event Sound Source Localization
item.description: In recent years, Event Sound Source Localization has been widely applied in various fields.

item.title: Constrained Decoding for Secure Code Generation
item.description: We propose new constrained decoding techniques to generate code that satisfies security and correctness constraints simultaneously.

item.title: Temporal Graph ODEs for Irregularly-Sampled Time Series
item.description: Modern graph representation learning works mostly under the assumption of dealing with regularly sampled temporal graph snapshots, which is far from realistic, e. g., social networks and physical systems are characterized by continuous dynamics and sporadic observations.

item.title: RAG and RAU: A Survey on Retrieval-Augmented Language Model in Natural Language Processing
item.description: Large Language Models (LLMs) have catalyzed significant advancements in Natural Language Processing (NLP), yet they encounter challenges such as hallucination and the need for domain-specific knowledge.

item.title: Towards a Search Engine for Machines: Unified Ranking for Multiple Retrieval-Augmented Large Language Models
item.description: This lays the groundwork for us to build a large-scale experimentation ecosystem consisting of 18 RAG systems that engage in training and 18 unknown RAG systems that use the uRAG as the new users of the search engine.

item.title: Complex contagions can outperform simple contagions for network reconstruction with dense networks or saturated dynamics
item.description: Network scientists often use complex dynamic processes to describe network contagions, but tools for fitting contagion models typically assume simple dynamics.

item.title: ATOMMIC: An Advanced Toolbox for Multitask Medical Imaging Consistency to facilitate Artificial Intelligence applications from acquisition to analysis in Magnetic Resonance Imaging
item.description: We benchmark 25 DL models on eight publicly available datasets to present distinct applications of ATOMMIC on accelerated MRI reconstruction, image segmentation, quantitative parameter map estimation, and joint accelerated MRI reconstruction and image segmentation utilizing MTL.

item.title: CLIP-Mamba: CLIP Pretrained Mamba Models with OOD and Hessian Evaluation
item.description: State space models and Mamba-based models have been increasingly applied across various domains, achieving state-of-the-art performance.

item.title: G2LTraj: A Global-to-Local Generation Approach for Trajectory Prediction
item.description: Finally, to ensure the optimal granularity of key steps, we design a selectable granularity strategy that caters to each predicted trajectory.

item.title: IgCONDA-PET: Implicitly-Guided Counterfactual Diffusion for Detecting Anomalies in PET Images
item.description: Minimizing the need for pixel-level annotated data for training PET anomaly segmentation networks is crucial, particularly due to time and cost constraints related to expert annotations.

item.title: MicroDreamer: Zero-shot 3D Generation in $\sim$20 Seconds by Score-based Iterative Reconstruction
item.description: In this paper, we introduce score-based iterative reconstruction (SIR), an efficient and general algorithm for 3D generation with a multi-view score-based diffusion model.

item.title: Transforming Dutch: Debiasing Dutch Coreference Resolution Systems for Non-binary Pronouns
item.description: We further show that CDA remains effective in low-resource settings, in which a limited set of debiasing documents is used.

item.title: AnomalyXFusion: Multi-modal Anomaly Synthesis with Diffusion
item.description: The AnomalyXFusion framework comprises two distinct yet synergistic modules: the Multi-modal In-Fusion (MIF) module and the Dynamic Dif-Fusion (DDF) module.

item.title: Towards Real-World HDR Video Reconstruction: A Large-Scale Benchmark Dataset and A Two-Stage Alignment Network
item.description: In this work, to facilitate the development of real-world HDR video reconstruction, we present Real-HDRV, a large-scale real-world benchmark dataset for HDR video reconstruction, featuring various scenes, diverse motion patterns, and high-quality labels.

item.title: Mixed Continuous and Categorical Flow Matching for 3D De Novo Molecule Generation
item.description: In this work, we explore the use of flow matching, a recently proposed generative modeling framework that generalizes diffusion models, for the task of de novo molecule generation.

item.title: One-Stage Open-Vocabulary Temporal Action Detection Leveraging Temporal Multi-scale and Action Label Features
item.description: Closed-vocab TAD is typically confined to localizing and classifying actions based on a predefined set of categories.

item.title: PCA for Point Processes
item.description: By treating point process realizations as random measures, we adopt a functional analysis perspective and propose a form of functional Principal Component Analysis (fPCA) for point processes.
